Nothing changed on the stage. The only
difference was the 55% catch rate on 3ds

Very easy as Players have Lucarionite
this time around. If you don't have one,
I suggest using Gengar instead

name: Onix
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds Metal Blocks on 3rd and 4th
          Row               
Timer: Adds Metal Blocks on 3rd and 4th
          Column after 5 turns
          Adds Metal Blocks on 3rd and 4th
          Row after 5 turns
          Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Mawile]/[Lucario]/
[Steelix]

Marowak, Stunfisk,
Donphan

Lucario, Swampert,
Suicune, Sceptile

Kyogre, Groudon,
Jirachi
clearingStrategy:
Okay this one is hard. A good way to
clear it is buy Disruption Delay to get
good combos at the start
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 9 moves left

DD and M-Luke
If you dont have Lucarionite, M-Mawile is
the same. This one is doable with DD but
if you are unsure, go Buy a Move+5

With the release of Mega Steelix, this can
be done itemless. Use Jirachi for Mega
Boost+ to get Steelix Mega Evolve earlier
mobileNotes:
Lower HP than 3ds version. Not just lower,
its 3300 HP less. You can expect this to be
easier than 3ds except that the catch rate
becomes 4% from 25%.

Froakie out if you have it making it easier.

No disruptions at first so feel free to

The video I watched get it without any
items using Mega Gengar, Donphan, 
Aurorus, and Swampert. You can try your
own set but if you cant clear it without item,
add a Move+5

name: Yamask
disruptions:
Board: Black Clouds at 1st & 6th Column
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Black Cloud every turn
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]

Zoroark, Mismagius,
Liepard

Yveltal

Giratina
clearingStrategy:
The Black Clouds isnt a problem here.
Hover your pen over the clouds then
press it to be able to "drag" the 
Pokemon in the block. This way you 
will be able to see what is in the cloud.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left
Pretty easy with a Mega Gengar team
mobileNotes: Just catch rate changes. Same team

name: Milotic
disruptions:
Board: Barrier all around and center,
           lots of Feebas
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3x3 blocks of Barrier after 3
          turns x2.
          Adds 3x3 blocks of Barrier, 3
          Column of Metal Blocks after 3 turns
          Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]

Dedenne, Jolteon,
Feebas

Zapdos, Raikou,
Sceptile

Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Feebas+Jolteon+Dedenne+M-Amphy
(Dont use M-Manectric) can clear this
without items. Use the Dedenne and
Jolteon for Mega Boosters and use
Ampharos when you get a match.

I defeated it with LV2 Amphy,
LV1 Jolteon, LV1 Dedenne and
LV1 Feebas (6 turns left)
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 15 moves left
Same team with clearing strategy and
Move+5 and decent level (5+) can do it or
you can go with stronger team (Zapdos
and Raikou) and Mega Start

Move+5 + DD and Mega Start can get this
done if the above strategy seems to
not work
mobileNotes:
This one is another same from 3ds. I still
recommend Mega Boosters than typical
Optimize team. Make sure to bring Feebas

name: Solosis
disruptions:
Board: X-Pattern Solosis, 2nd and 5th row
           partially in Barrier
Initial: None
Timer: None
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]

Zoroark, Scyther,
Scizor, Heracross,
Solosis

Yveltal

Giratina
clearingStrategy:
Match a Solosis. It has Barrier Bash
and will get rid of Barrier. If you got
lucky, the upper barrier will be gone
and you can start your combo.
Otherwise, match another or bring
a Barrier Bash
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Itemless with Mega Gengar. Adding
Solosis to your team makes this really
easy
mobileNotes: Nothing changed. Just catch rate

name: Timburr
disruptions:
Board: 3rd and 4th Column is Metal Blocks
Initial: None
Timer: None

Note: 2x6 Metal Blocks will skyfall next on
         3rd and 4th Column after a 2x4 of
         your Pokemon
recommendedParty:
[Mewtwo]/[Slowbro]
 
Snubbull, Azumarill,
Chimecho
 
Xerneas, Mewtwo

Victini, Cresselia,
Wobbuffet, Lugia
clearingStrategy:
No disruptions here but since we cant
destroy the Metal Blocks at the center,
we have to wait for 5 turns each to
get some decent combos
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 17 moves left

Mega Start+ Move+5 will do this.
You may want to swap Xerneas for
a good Psychic type (Victini, Wobbuffet,
Chimecho) if you are using Mega Mewtwo.
Snubbull with Crowd Control will do
wonders in this stage

You may use Complexity if you are having
really really trouble S-Ranking this
notes:
One of the hardest to S-Rank in
this area..
mobileNotes: Nothing change except for catch rate

name: Mega Aerodactyl
disruptions:
Board: Rocks at the center, and 1 at every
           side
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Row of Rocks every 6 turns

25% Health: Adds 3x3 Metal Blocks
                   every 3 moves

Added Support: Rocks
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Blastoise]/
[Venusaur]/[Garchomp]

Donphan, Stunfisk,
Marowak, Steelix

Lucario, Suicune,
Swampert, Sceptile,
Cobalion, Virizion

Kyogre, Groudon, Dialga,
Registeel
clearingStrategy:
You may need Mega Lucario or
Mega Blastoise in here for Super
Effective Megas. Too much Wooden
Blocks. A Mega Start would also
be awesome

With the release of M-Garchomp, this
gets easier (specially if you have
Dialga and other strong Super
Effectives)
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 12 moves left

Move+5 and Mega Start will do this.

Mega Aero can be optional.
mobileNotes:
The health disruption will trigger from 25% to
23% now. Also has higher HP than 3ds
(About 1600 higher). Also note that mobile
players only have Lucario as Mega here but since
Mobile players have Dialga and Palkia, this
will be a little bit easier
